text: hi everyone and welcome my name is
sushmita bakur and I am a Senior
Solutions architect at AWS in this video
we will demonstrate how you can start
exploring the Amazon Q generative SQL
feature in Amazon rshift query editor
this feature can generate SQL
recommendations from natural language
prompts thereby simplifying query
authoring and increasing your
productivity the feature was launched
during AWS re invent 2023 and is current
ly available for public
preview to use this feature first go to
the AWS console homepage and search for
Amazon R shift here from the search bar
or click on the service name if already
available in your recently visited
Services the Amazon Q generative SQL
feature can be used either on a
provision cluster or R shift serverless
endpoint you can refer to the AWS
documentation on how to create a rift
cluster this feature is available for
public preview in the AWS regions of
North Virginia Oregon and Frankfurt for
this demo we will be using the North
Virginia
region if you are using Amazon Ria for
the first time you will see the option
to try Rift serverless within the Amazon
Rift homepage you can click on it and
create a default Rift serverless
namespace and work group you can also
try this demo on any of your existing
clusters here on the screen you can see
the sh serverless dashboard with the
default name space and the default work
group that I have pre-created and will
be using for this
demo now to open the Amazon rare shift
query editor V2 you can click on query
data here on the top right of the

on query editor V2 from the left
navigation pane of the rift console
either of these options will open the
Amazon red shift query editor V2 in a
new

the Amazon Q generative SQL feature for
R shift has a number of built-in safety
features as well it will warn you if a
generat SQL statement will modify the

to delete data from a table delete data

be as specific as possible instead of
